comment: Very lecture heavy with three tests over the course of the semester. No homework besides weekly 10-question quizzes and an easy group project towards the end of the semester. Really easy if you just pay attention to the notes. Also gives 10 points of extra credit on each test besides the final.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He gives a 5  bonus pt opportunity before every test, and his lectures are fun and engaging. Habitually late (once showed up 16 minutes and still took attendance.(uncool!) Really strict about time limit on the group project but obviously not for being on time himself. Not the most organized guy but not a bad prof. I'd be cool w/ taking him again.

Got an A in this class fairly easy.  Just show up, pay attention, and you should get at least a B if you do the bare minimum.  He clearly states what happened when and who and what.  Just remember all the names.  Group project at the end was easy, but some people struggled.

He makes his lectures interesting and class is never really boring. Overall the class isn't too difficult. I never used the book and still did well in the class just by using the notes he puts on D2L. If you only study those, you can still get an A. Weekly quizzes are all online. Group project is easy if you follow directions.

Very good and would take again. Study and it's an easy A. Took easy online quizzes and tests in class that where not very difficult if you studied. He scheduled our final 10 days earlier than the original date and was 50 questions that took less than 30 minutes. Very good definitely one of my favorites. No technology allowed when class starts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: His lectures keep me intrigued and I found that most of the information was review from high school. However he is constantly late. He hardly gives you any work outside class. There is a group assignment that consists of a presentation. Really easy A if you just come to class read the chapters before the test and do the work.

He is one of the best history teachers I've had. The quizzes are online and are fairly easy. The test are a bit more detailed. There is a bonus he does for the test also.  Sometimes he is late and there is a group project. Also there is a textbook but I never used it. Could help with studying.

Randomly cancels class without notice. Frequently late. Group project for history.. Very good speaker but often rushes to get through the material. Takes mandatory attendance. But if you go to class and take notes, it is a pretty easy class.

This is by far the most inconsiderate professor I have ever had. He canceled classes and was late very consistently with no warning or explanation. Ironically, he also has a very strict attendance policy. Lectures were rushed, but notes are posted online, so be sure to read. However, notes were removed from D2L 4 days before the final.

Dr. Kefentse makes you think he's a really chill professor, but you get your group project grade back and quickly realize that he's not. He's a tough grader. However, his tests weren't that challenging and he is EXTREMELY good at explaining history and making it interesting. The quizzes aren't too bad as long as you've read the book. I recommend.
He cancels class randomly. Takes attendance everyday. Take notes and you'll pass. Tough grader on group project.

Great teacher! Actually one of the best history teachers I've taken. Only issue i run into with him is that sometimes he randomly cancels class with NO warning /or email. Other than that, his class is easy as long as you read the book and pay attention in class. He even posts ALL of his lectures on D2L as well. STRICT tardy policy. Quizzes easy.
His tests are pretty simple just have to study! if you don't study you will regret it. makes lectures funny and interesting and is passionate in what he teaches. easy class overall and easy material.

Dr. Kefentse makes a class that could be super boring, super interesting. He gives the notes online for you to add to during lecture. Quizzes are online and easy if you've read the book and notes. As long as you study properly, you'll do well in this class.

Dr. Kefentse is the best history professor I have ever had. He takes attendance every day but he puts the notes online so if you miss class you have something to look over. Most of the questions on the tests are from the lectures so going to class is key. If you just do the work you'll get an A. I thought it was a really easy class.

Only 3 absences are allowed. 11 quizzes, all are 10 questions taken directly from Quizlet. 4 tests- kind of difficult. Overall, the class would be so much better with a different professor. I personally had a terrible experience with Dr. Kefentse. He never responded in a professional manner to my emails and he graded unneccessarily harshly.

Dr. Kefenste gives notes online to print and annotate during class, but he takes attendance. Quizzes are weekly online and their are only 3 tests, excluding the final. He usually runs late so keep that in mind when rushing to class, but he rarely cancels.
Very interesting to listen to in lectures, if you do the quizzes and the reading the tests are easy. gives chances for extra credit and makes the boredom of history almost non-existent.
